reviews.review: One of the best first-person shooters ever made. An absolute classic.

Ein Legend√§res Spiel das in keiner guten Spielesammlung fehlen sollte. Bis heute ist es mehr als Schade das Valve nach der 2 Episode des Spiel Schluss gemacht hat. Einen solchen Cliffhanger hat keiner verdient. Aber nichtsdestotrotz begeistert mich das Spiel von damals bis heute. 
Das einzige was mich richtig st√∂rt ist die wirklich schlechte deutsche Syncro und die absolut Sinnfreie und schwachsinige Zensur der Deutschen Version: Weniger Blut: Ok kann man mit Leben
Blut Grau Statt Rot: Naja aber auch damit kann man klarkommen
Tote NPCs die sich nach ihrem Tod vollst√§ndig aufl√∂sen noch bevor sie auf dem Boden angekommen sind: 
St√∂rt die Atmo total und sieht zuweilen einfach nur Bes******n aus. 
Entfernen von Dekoleichen: F√§llt h√§ufig nichtmal auf aber wenn man es wei√ü und sogar eine der Protagonisten 
einen lustigen Satz √ºber die Leiche fallen l√§sst und dort jedoch nichtmal etwas sitzt macht das einfach keinen Spa√ü.

Nun gut Gl√ºcklicherweise l√§sst sich Half Life 2 und beide Episoden ja sehr leicht in seinen alten ungeschnittenen Zustand zur√ºck versetzen.
Aber trotzdem ich liebe dieses Spiel.

One of the worst games I've played in years. I really don't know why everyone's recommending it. Way more hype than it deserves. About an hour into it I came to a canal and couldn't progress further until I stacked boxes and barrels to get up to street level. I spent about fifteen minutes with this tedius task only to reach an invisible barrier or something that prevented me from jumping up 1ft to the street... absolutely rediculous. It was like a 2 year-old's game of building blocks with zero skill or brain power required to solve it, but it's incredibly frustrating and painstakingly boring to gather up these items to build a makeshift staircase. Developers, please utilize ladders instead of insisting people undergo these boring and tedius tasks! Overall I defnitely wouldn't recommend this game and am glad I only paid about $1.50 for it during a Steam sale. If you want similar gameplay with better graphics go with the Metro games instead. I'll be steering clear from anything made by Valve from now on.
J'ai √©jacul√© √† la fin pourtant je suis sterile :o

Pros:
- Overall a very good game, despite being well-aged. 
- One of the best story-telling in a video game I've ever seen. 99.9% of the story is told through NPC interaction and dialogue, and there's basically no text boxes at all in this game.
- The game strikes a very nice balance between action-packed and tense moments  and calm, safe moments. This way, you can always take some time to relax after going through a series of action-packed moments.
- Music is excellent as well. Headphones are recommended as they also allow you to hear NPCs better. 
- Puzzles are fairly challenging, but not too challenging to the point where I had to look up a walkthrough.
- Smooth and easy-to-use controls.
- You don't really need to play the first Half-Life to understand the plot, but it's still recommended.
- Can run on a toaster. No fancy-shmancy gaming rig needed. 
- At time of writing, the game is going on sale for a very low price. If you haven't bought it yet, I highly recommend getting it as it is worth every penny.

Neutrals:
- The play time is kinda short. Managed to beat the game in 12 hours, but that was definitely one of the best 12 hours of my gaming experience.
- Graphics obviously aren't as good as new gen games, but IMO, it's actually pretty good for a 14 year old game.

Cons:
- Protagonist kinda relies too much on NPCs for help. Would be nice if we could open at least some of the electronic doors ourselves.
- Most of the enemies are too squishy and rely heavily on strength in numbers to even be a challenge. Also, there's nearly no variation in the way they attack. 
- The NPC allies you get near the end of the game are a bit dumb. Would've been nice if they followed you more and don't get caught up in pointless fights against walkers and stuff. 

Overall, I give it a 9/10. Again, if the game's on sale and you don't have it yet, definitely get it.

Assieme a Return to Castle Wolfenstein, √® il miglior prodotto che abbia mai giocato. Grafica avvincente, con un "motore grafico" che √® pi√π 'vivibile' di quello di altri prodotti che sono usciti anche 10 anni dopo... fantastico. Forse √® definibile la pietra miliare della storia dei videogiochi. Half-Life 1 non mi √® mai piaciuto molto, ma il 2 √® incredibile, stupendo, ecc... non basterebbero tutti gli aggettivi positivi del dizionario italiano per definirlo.
Secondo me √® uno dei pochi casi della storia dei videogiochi in cui il sequel supera il primo episodio.
E' come vivere un film da protagonista attivo. Da consigliare o regalare a un amico senza dubbio.

Played all the Half Life's on the Xbox platform, and gotta say, this game is my most favorite game of all time. Combat is fun, with the mix of puzzles and shit hitting the fan. If you dislike this franchise and have never played it, give it a try. This game stands up to the test of time, and is the the most influential game you'll ever play.

Excelente juego, super recomendado, extraordinaria historia y una jugabilidad de 10/10

I always dreamed of playing Half-Life 2, since I played it in my early childhood.
And when I finally bought it, it was FAR more amazing and fun that I expected.

The soundtrack is unbeatable, gameplay is great, combat is fun amd the whole game feels very organic.
I reccomend this game to the hardcore FPS gamers, as the game is the origin of the most today's FPS games, but also to the average person who to complete the game and understand the meaning behind it.

Buy this game.
BUY IT.
